title: Biological pest control can harm valuable species

content.prompt: Biological controls are frequently used to replace persistent chemical pesticides. Which of the following represents the greatest potential risk of using biological controls?

choices.label: The control agent attacks not only its intended target but also beneficial species.
The control agent mutates and is no longer an effective control agent.
Repeated applications or introductions are required to eliminate the pest population.
Residual pesticides in the environment kill the control agent before it can eradicate the pest.
Biological controls prove to be more costly to use than chemical pesticides.

skill.text: Skill 7.C: Describe disadvantages, advantages, or unintended consequences for potential solutions.
